New Records: Kyle Farmer hit a three-run home run in the second inning
Matt Wallner hit a solo shot in the third
Carlos Santana hit a two-run shot for his team-best 21st homer
Key Match Events: Pablo López won his fourth straight start with 10 strikeouts over seven innings
Zach Neto hit a three-run homer in the fifth that cut the lead to 6-4
Trevor Larnach reached base all four times he batted, with a single and three walks
Pre-Game Insights: The Twins were trying to stop a four-game losing streak
They had lost 15 of their previous 21 games and were trying to preserve a three-game edge with 17 games to go in the chase for the last of three AL wild-card spots
Post-Match Reflections: López said the team was not used to losing and it was cool and special to see them playing loose and having fun
Manager Rocco Baldelli said no one can kill the lucky summer sausage, which was brought back out after Farmer's home run
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Twins preserved a three-game edge with 17 games to go in the chase for the last of three AL wild-card spots
The Angels were sent to their 21st loss in their last 30 games
López has been Minnesota's most valuable player since the All-Star break, stabilizing an injury-thinned rotation
